alert.note: Alert for Evangeline; St. Landry (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 10:31AM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Evangeline and northern St. Landry Parishes through 1100 AM CDT... At 1031 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Grand Prairie, or 8 miles north of Opelousas, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Opelousas, Ville Platte, Krotz Springs, Melville, Palmetto, Bayou Current, Port Barre, Washington, Chataignier, Prairie Ronde, Grand Prairie and Lebeau. This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 19 and 37. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
